intro: Jussiaea myrtifolia subf. latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf jussiaea, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically pollinated by insects. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
